name: Carolyn Raphael
bio:
Poet and teacher Carolyn Raphael is the author of the poetry collections Dancing with Bare Feet (White Violet Press, 2016), The Most Beautiful Room in the World (David Robert Books, 2010), and the chapbooks Grandma Poems—Not Too Sweet (Kelsay Books, 2017) and Diagrams of Bittersweet (Somers Rocks Press, 1997). Her poems have appeared in journals including Long Island Quarterly, The Lyric, Oberon, Measure, and Blue Unicorn, and on the Newington-Cropsey Cultural Studies website for the American Arts Quarterly, where her poem, “Honorable Mention,” was nominated for a Pushcart Prize.
 
Raphael taught English at Queensborough Community College, CUNY, for over 30 years. She has published two college textbooks with Macmillan: Rhetorical Reader for ESL Writers (1983, with Elaine Goran Newman) and The Writing Reader (1986). She coedited an essay collection entitled Language and Cognition (Plenum Press, 1984).
 
Raphael is the poetry coordinator of Great Neck Plaza in Great Neck, New York, where
she oversees the annual Great Neck Plaza Poetry Contest and directs “Poetry in the Plaza,” which places poems on local bulletin boards.
